questions.question_text: Which three commands can be used to set PL/SQL conditional compilation inquiry directive MODE?

discussion.content: A, B and E are the right answer

Selected Answer: BD
EXISTS(n) returns TRUE if the nth element in a collection exists. Otherwise, EXISTS(n) returns FALSE.

Selected Answer: BD
BD is correct

comments.content:
B and D, not E
because we see in this snippet using EXTEND function wich adds an NULL element in the collection.

discussion.content: B and E are correct answers. I verified it.

choices.D: BEGIN 1_emp := emp_typ (); IF NOT 1_emp. EXISTS (1) THEN DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE (Summary is null); END IF END;
choices.B: BEGIN 1_rec.emp_id :=1; 1_rec.expr_summary := NULL; 1_emp :=emp_typ (1_rec); IF 1_emp(1).expr_summary IS NULL THEN DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE (Summary is null); END IF; END;
choices.E: BEGIN 1_emp. EXTEND; IF NOT 1_emp. EXISTS (1) THEN DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE (Summary is null); END IF
choices.C: BEGIN 1_rec.emp_id :=1; 1_rec.expr_summary := EMPTY_CLOB (); 1_emp := emp_typ (1_rec); IF 1_emp(1).expr_summary IS NULL THEN DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE (Summary is null); END IF END;
choices.A: BEGIN 1_rec := NULL; 1_emp := emp_typ (1_rec); IF 1_emp (1).expr_summary IS EMPTY THEN DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE (Summary is null); END IF; END;

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: EF
EF should be correct

choices.F: Modify the function return type to return a scalar, VARCHAR2.
choices.B: Declare the collection type inside the function.
choices.A: Change RETURN p_tab.LAST to RETURN p_tab.COUNT.
choices.C: Declare the collection type at the schema level instead of the package.
choices.D: Define the function as stand-alone instead of in a package body.
choices.E: Change the INDEX BY clause from VARCHAR2 to PLS_INTEGER.

choices.B: Initialize v1 and v2 with appropriate constructor functions.
choices.D: Nothing because using the function TABLE (V1) is prohibited.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC is correct, v2 needs to be declared as a record type - those two answers achieve exactly that

comments.content: sry, AC is the right answer

questions.question_text:
A products TABLE exists with a PROD_ID column.
Examine this PL/SQL block:
//IMG//

Which statement is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

A is the correct answer. for more details check the link below:
 http://www.dba-oracle.com/t_adv_plsql_to_refcursor.htm
A is the only correct answer.

choices.D: It executes successfully only if the FETCH statement is replaced by DBMS_SQL.RETURN_RESULT (v_ref_cur);
choices.A: It executes successfully only if v_ref_cur := DBMS_SQL.TO_REFCURSOR (V_CUR); is added before the FETCH statement.
choices.E: It executes successfully only if the FETCH statement is replaced by DBMS_SQL.FETCH_ROWS (v_cur);
choices.C: It executes successfully only if v_ref_cur: = DBMS_SQL.TO_CURSOR_NUMBER (v_cur); is added before the FETCH statement.
